annotation.text: UCP2 content, measured by calibrated immunoblot in INS-1E insulinoma cells (a pancreatic beta-cell model) grown in RPMI medium, and INS-1E mitochondria, was 2.0 ng/million cells (7.9 ng/mg mitochondrial protein).

annotation.infon: cellular response to amino acid starvation|GO:0034198
annotation.text: UCP2 content was lower in cells incubated without glutamine and higher in cells incubated with 20 mM glucose, and varied from 1.

Uncoupling protein 2 (UCP2) regulates glucose-stimulated insulin secretion in pancreatic beta-cells.

annotation.text: UCP2 content was lower in cells incubated without glutamine and higher in cells incubated with 20 mM glucose, and varied from 1.0-4.4 ng/million cells (2.7-14.5 ng/mg mitochondrial protein).

The UCP2 content of mitochondria isolated from the same cells was 7.9 ng/mg of mitochondrial protein
The UCP2 content of mitochondria isolated from the same cells was 7.9 ng/mg of mitochondrial protein (Fig. 2B, control bar).

annotation.infon: cellular response to amino acid starvation|GO:0034198
annotation.text: Omission of glutamine from the medium resulted in decreases in UCP2 in cells and mitochondria

annotation.infon: cellular response to amino acid starvation|GO:0034198
annotation.text: Omission of glutamine from the medium resulted in decreases in UCP2 in cells and mitochondria (Fig. 2A and B) without affecting Ucp2 mRNA levels (Fig. 2C).

annotation.infon: cellular response to amino acid starvation|GO:0034198
annotation.text: Protein content changed significantly but mRNA did not, suggesting that UCP2 is translationally controlled by glutamine in INS-1E cells, in agreement with studies in other cells [19,20]
Omission of glutamine from the medium resulted in decreases in UCP2 in cells and mitochondria
Omission of glutamine from the medium resulted in decreases in UCP2 in cells and mitochondria
Lowering glucose to 2 mM had no effect on UCP2 protein or mRNA, but doubling glucose concentration to 20 mM increased protein levels 2-fold over control
but doubling glucose concentration to 20 mM increased protein levels 2-fold over control
Fig. 3A shows that the antibody detected UCP2 in spleen, kidney and pancreas mitochondria from wild-type mice and rats, but not in Ucp2-/- mice.
Fig. 3A shows that the antibody detected UCP2 in spleen, kidney and pancreas mitochondria from wild-type mice and rats, but not in Ucp2-/- mice.
UCP2 levels were stable in isolated mitochondria
